title: Numerical Instability of Algebraic Rootfinding Methods
abstract:
We demonstrate that the most popular variants of all common algebraic
multidimensional rootfinding algorithms are unstable by analyzing the
conditioning of subproblems that are constructed at intermediate steps. In
particular, we give multidimensional polynomial systems for which the
conditioning of a subproblem can be worse than the conditioning of the original
problem by a factor that grows exponentially with the number of variables.
